xmlUpload.dialogIntro: If your accounting program is capable of exporting data in the eCH-0217-Standard (eVAT) , you can transfer the VAT declaration data directly from your financial accounting program.
xmlUpload.dialogIntroMore: Export the reporting period as an eCH-2017 XML document in your accounting program. Then select the exported eCH-0217 XML document in VAT-declaration pro for the data import. After the import, the data must be checked and supplemented if necessary. Subsequently, the declaration report can be submitted normally.
xmlUpload.dialogXmlInfo: The company as well as the tax period concerned are automatically recognized during import.

error.importFailedContent: The file could not be read. Please check if it is a valid XML document according to the eCH-0217 standard.

line1.pauschal: Supplies provided abroad (for example, Paris-Berlin, place of supply is abroad) must be declared in Ref. 200 and deducted in Ref. 221. Such supplies may therefore not be listed in this form.
line1.saldo: Supplies provided abroad (for example, Paris-Berlin, place of supply is abroad) must be declared in Ref. 200 and deducted in Ref. 221. Such supplies may therefore not be listed in this form.

line2.pauschal:
Reduction of consideration (discounts, rebates, etc.) are to be taken into account as follows:
a) If the invoice in question is included in this form, the reduced amount has to be entered;
b) If the invoice in question was included previously, the deduction - including the relevant invoice information - must be declared.
line2.saldo:
VAT reductions resulting from a reduction of the invoice amount (for example, through subsequent discounts, discounts and cancellations) shall be taken into account as follows:
a) If the invoice in question is included in this statement, the reduced amounts shall be entered;
b) If the invoice in question was included in a previous invoice application, the corresponding deduction - including the underlying invoice - shall be made at the end of the statement.

line3.pauschal: In the case of accommodation services (tax rate until 31.12.2017: 3.8%; from 1.1.2018: 3.7%), the tax credit is only possible if the accommodation services to after Article 143 VAT Ordinance beneficiary institutions and persons are provided.

prior2018.pauschal: In the case of accommodation services (tax rate until 31.12.2010: 3.6%; from 1.1.2011: 3.8%), the tax credit is only possible if the accommodation services are provided to beneficiary institutions and persons according to Article 143 VAT Ordinance.
prior2018.saldo: In the case of accommodation services (tax rate until 31.12.2010: 3.6%; from 1.1.2011: 3.8%), the tax credit is only possible if the accommodation services are provided to beneficiary institutions and persons according to Article 143 VAT Ordinance.

line3.saldo: For accommodation services (tax rate until 31.12.2017: 3.8%; from 1.1.2018: 3.7%), tax credit only applies if the accommodation services are provided to beneficiary institutions and persons as details in Article 143 VAT Ordinance.

form1050.ExpandTitle1: the electronic submission of this form confirms that

content.pauschal: The declared VAT is credited to export deliveries of items (see point 10 of the VAT-Info 12 Net tax rates) as well as domestic supplies to beneficiary institutions and persons as detailed in Article 143 VAT Ordinance if the official form is used. The total amount of tax must be declared in Ref. 470. You can delete all entries by resetting the form.
content.saldo: The declared VAT is credited to export deliveries of items (see point 10 of the VAT-Info 12 Net tax rates) as well as domestic supplies to beneficiary institutions and persons as detailed in Article 143 VAT Ordinance if the official form is used. The total amount of tax must be declared in Ref. 470. You can delete all entries by resetting the form.

content1055.pauschal: For each sale of an individualisable movable good that you have purchased for this purpose, you can choose either the approved flat-rate tax on the consideration, or the the fixed flat-rate tax of 6.5% (or 6.7% until 31.12.2017) on the margin. To use the second option, create a separate list and carry the accumulated sales resp. and margins in the following form (see paragraph 12.2 of the MWST-Info 12 Net Tax Rates). The difference will be transferred to the declaration, Ref. 471. You can delete all entries, by resetting the form.

prior2018.pauschal: For each sale of an individualisable movable good that you have purchased for this purpose, you can choose either the approved flat-rate tax on the consideration, or the the fixed flat-rate tax of 6.7% (or 6.4% until 31.12.2010) on the margin. To use the second option, create a separate list and carry the accumulated sales resp. and margins in the following form (see paragraph 12.2 of the MWST-Info 12 Net Tax Rates). The total difference will be transferred to the declaration report, Ref. 471. You can delete all entries, by resetting the form.
prior2018.saldo: For each sale of an individualisable movable good that you have purchased for this purpose, you can choose either the approved flat-rate tax on the consideration, or the the fixed flat-rate tax of 6.7% (or 6.4% until 31.12.2010) on the margin. To use the second option, create a separate list and carry the accumulated sales resp. and margins in the following form (see paragraph 12.2 of the MWST-Info 12 Net Tax Rates). The total difference will be transferred to the declaration report, Ref. 471. You can delete all entries, by resetting the form.

content1055.saldo: For each sale of an individualisable movable good that you have purchased for this purpose, you can choose either the approved flat-rate tax on the consideration, or the the fixed flat-rate tax of 6.5% (or 6.7% until 31.12.2017) on the margin. To use the second option, create a separate list and carry the accumulated sales resp. and margins in the following form (see paragraph 12.2 of the MWST-Info 12 Net Tax Rates). The difference will be transferred to the declaration, Ref. 471. You can delete all entries, by resetting the form.

expandContent1.pauschal: This Regulation does not apply to automobiles up to a total weight of 3.5 tonnes and also not in all other cases where according to Art. 28a MWSTG i.a.w. Art.90 Abs. 2 VAT the deduction of the notional input tax is excluded. All items for which you wish to credit the notional input tax must be listed separately (see paragraph 12.2 of the MWST-Info 12 Saldosteuersätze). You must submit this list to the FTA on request. The total consideration of the sale must be listed in full under Ref. 200 of the declaration and under Ref. 322 and/or Ref. 321 with the applicable flat tax rate.

prior2018.pauschal: This Regulation does not apply to automobiles up to a total weight of 3.5 tonnes and also not in all other cases where according to Art. 28a MWSTG i.a.w. Art.90 Abs. 2 VAT the deduction of the notional input tax is excluded. All items for which you wish to credit the notional input tax must be listed separately (see paragraph 12.2 of the MWST-Info 12 Saldosteuersätze). You must submit this list to the FTA on request. The total consideration of the sale must be listed in full under Ref. 200 of the declaration and under Ref. 322 and/or Ref. 321 with the applicable flat tax rate.
prior2018.saldo: This Regulation does not apply to automobiles up to a total weight of 3.5 tonnes and also not in all other cases where according to Art. 28a MWSTG i.a.w. Art.90 Abs. 2 VAT the deduction of the notional input tax is excluded. All items for which you wish to credit the notional input tax must be listed separately (see paragraph 12.2 of the MWST-Info 12 Saldosteuersätze). You must submit this list to the FTA on request. The total consideration of the sale must be listed in full under Ref. 200 of the declaration and under Ref. 322 and/or Ref. 321 with the applicable flat tax rate.

expandContent1.saldo: This Regulation does not apply to automobiles up to a total weight of 3.5 tonnes and also not in all other cases where according to Art. 28a MWSTG i.a.w. Art.90 Abs. 2 VAT the deduction of the notional input tax is excluded. All items for which you wish to credit the notional input tax must be listed separately (see paragraph 12.2 of the MWST-Info 12 Saldosteuersätze). You must submit this list to the FTA on request. The total consideration of the sale must be listed in full under Ref. 200 of the declaration and under Ref. 322 and/or Ref. 321 with the applicable flat tax rate.

form1055.expandContent2: The form is also applicable to individualisable movable goods purchased and sold at a total price. To proceed in such cases, please contact the Eidg. Tax Administration Department VAT.
form1055.expandOldTaxLink: Do you want to credit notional input tax deductions at the tax rate (before 01.01.2018)?
form1055.prior2018expandOldTaxLink: Do you want to credit notional input tax deductions at the tax rate (before 01.01.2011)?
form1055.subContent: There are no customer invoices recorded. To register a new customer invoice, select 'Add invoice'.
form1055.subTitle: Customer invoices
form1055.title: Forms 1055 and 1056

content1056.pauschal: If you have purchased a collector’s item such as art objects, antiques etc., you can control the apply margin taxation as detailed in Art. 24a VAT Act You must list all the items individually and determine the total turnover and the total margin on Form 1056 (similar to the notional deduction of input tax, see Clause 12.2 of the VAT Info Net Tax Rates). If the purchase price of a collector’s item exceeds the selling price, the margin shall be the loss. The total difference is then transferred to the declaration (Ref. 471). You can delete all entries made by resetting the form.
content1056.saldo: If you have purchased a collector’s item such as art objects, antiques etc., you can control the apply margin taxation as detailed in Art. 24a VAT Act You must list all the items individually and determine the total turnover and the total margin on Form 1056 (similar to the notional deduction of input tax, see Clause 12.2 of the VAT Info Net Tax Rates). If the purchase price of a collector’s item exceeds the selling price, the margin shall be the loss. The total difference is then transferred to the declaration (Ref. 471). You can delete all entries made by resetting the form.

expandContent.pauschal: If you want to use margin taxation as detailed in Art. 48b MWSTV for collector items you have purchased for resale, you may not include VAT in the invoice. All items for which you want to apply margin taxation must be listed separately (similar to the notional input tax, see Clause 12.2 of the VAT Info Net Tax Rates). You must sign this list and submit only on request. The consideration must be listed in Ref. 200 of the declaration and taxed under Ref. 321/322 at the approved flat tax rate. If you have been granted several flat tax rates, you need to apply the appropriate flat tax rate to each item on the list. The form is also applicable to collectors items and sold at a total price. In this case, please contact the Federal Tax Administration.
expandContent.saldo: If you want to use margin taxation as detailed in Art. 48b MWSTV for collector items you have purchased for resale, you may not include VAT in the invoice. All items for which you want to apply margin taxation must be listed separately (similar to the notional input tax, see Clause 12.2 of the VAT Info Net Tax Rates). You must sign this list and submit only on request. The consideration must be listed in Ref. 200 of the declaration and taxed under Ref. 321/322 at the approved flat tax rate. If you have been granted several flat tax rates, you need to apply the appropriate flat tax rate to each item on the list. The form is also applicable to collectors items and sold at a total price. In this case, please contact the Federal Tax Administration.

form1056.subContent: There are no customer invoices recorded. To register a new customer invoice, select 'Add invoice'.
form1056.subTitle: Customer invoices
form1056.title: Forms 1055 and 1056

form3xx.content: Please record the activity of the taxable person with the consideration. If more than one flat-rate tax rate has been granted to the taxable person, the average rate will be determined by entering several activities. The total consideration and the tax amount will be transferred to the declaration (Ref. 321 and 322). You can delete all entries by resetting the form.

label.total: Total amount of tax from customer invoices:

form3xx.prior2018content: Please record the activity of the taxable person with the corresponding turnover. If more than one flat tax rate has been approved for the taxable person, the average rate is determined by specifying several activities. The turnover total and the tax amount are then transferred to the declaration report (Ref. 321 + 320). You can delete all entries made by resetting the form.
form3xx.title: Calculation for average flat rate
form3xx.warning: Do you want to delete all entries?

header.title: Declaration informations and deadlines
header.tooltip: This is the ordinary deadline for submissions. Any extension to the deadline is not displayed here.
header.valuta: Value date (interest on late payment from)

info.annualDeclarationTxt: This form is used to correct any deficiencies found within the previous tax period. Therefore, only the differences from the submitted declarations are to be declared. If no deficiencies were found, the form does not need to be submitted. The submission deadline is 240 days after the end of the tax period.
info.annualDeclarationTxt2EFF: Please fill out the annual rectification report (correction statement according to Art. 72 VAT Act) completely and submit it online. Information on how to fill it in can be found in MWST-Info 15.
info.annualDeclarationTxt2PSS: Please fill out the annual rectification report (correction statement according to Art. 72 VAT Act) completely and submit it online. Information on how to fill it in can be found in MWST-Info 13.
info.annualDeclarationTxt2SSS: Please fill out the annual rectification report (correction statement according to Art. 72 VAT Act) completely and submit it online. Information on how to fill it in can be found in MWST-Info 12.
info.auditingInProgressMessage: The declaration report is currently being reviewed by another user and cannot be opened.
info.creditPayment: Payment of credits will be made only after processing the submitted form.
info.currencyHint: All numbers are accepted as francs and centimes.
info.description: You will find information on how to complete the declaration in the MWST-Info 15
info.description_pauschal: You will find information on how to complete the declaration in the MWST-Info 13
info.description_saldo: You will find information on how to complete the declaration in the MWST-Info 12
info.editingInProgressMessage: The declaration report is currently being processed by another user and cannot be opened.
info.finalDeclarationTxt:
Do you still have goods or services for which the input tax deduction was claimed? Declare the own consumption in Ref. 415: To determine the current value, reduce the claimed input tax amount on a straight-line basis for each year that has elapsed

  • 20% for movable goods or services
  • for immovable goods by 5%.

For further information, please refer to VAT Info 10

Please note: If items have already been declared in the ordinary declaration, they do not need to be declared again in the final one.
info.saldo: All declared turnover is to be entered gross incl. VAT.
info.sapNotAvailable: Unfortunately, the bank details cannot be transmitted electronically at the moment. The FTA will send you a form to report your bank details by mail. We kindly ask you to fill it in and return it to the FTA. We apologize for the inconvenience.

landingPage.info: Do you need an extension of declaration and/or payment? You can apply online: VAT extension
landingPage.overview:
The declaration of {{periodName}} for which the VAT Token {{vattoken}} was provided on {{submittedDate}} by {{firstName}} {{lastName}}{{company}} for the Approval of Declaration.

Please forward the Approval of Declaration to the person responsible for the approval. The signed Approval of Declaration must be sent by mail to the following address:

Federal Tax Administration
Department MWST
Schwarztorstrasse
3024 Bern

Important: The declaration is only deemed to be submitted, if the Approval of Declaration arrives by mail at the FTA.

Do you want to correct the declaration before approval? You can make corrections to the declaration and create a new version using the VAT Token. This function can be used up until the Approval of Declaration is received by the FTA.

Payment information, the VAT Token for the next declaration and further information can be found in the PDF summary of your declaration.

net_gross.tooltip:
If the turnover is declared without VAT (net turnover) in box Ref. 200, VAT is calculated at the applicable tax rate of 7.7%, 2.5% and/or 3.7%.

If the consideration type is gross (including VAT) in Ref. 200, the consideration is calculated on the basis of 107.7%, 102.5% and/or 103.7%. In this case, VAT is calculated using a multiplier (7.7% = 7.1495%, 2.5% = 2.4390% and 3.7% = 3.5680%).

The consideration type of remuneration (net or gross) must be maintained applied throughout the entire tax period. It This is automatically taken into account in the tax calculation (numbers Ref. 301 - 342 of the form).

other_cash_flow_section.900_description: Subsidies, funds that tourist offices receive from public law tourist charges, contributions from cantonal water, sewage or waste funds (art. 18 para. 2 lit. a to c) Ref. 900
other_cash_flow_section.910_description: Donations, dividends, payments of damages etc. (art. 18 para. 2 lit. d to l)
other_cash_flow_section.title: Other flows (art. 18 para. 2)

stepper.contactData: Contact details of the filling person
stepper.remindertNextDeclaration: VAT token and reminder: next reporting period

submitted.deadline: This information is available until {{deadline}}. We recommend you save the documents locally.

submitted.overviewFinal: The {{periodName}} with VAT token {{vattoken}} was submitted on {{submittedDate}} by {{firstName}} {{lastName}}{{company}}.

tax_calculation_section.380_help: Please enter the supplies received for the acquisition tax here. The supplies received are taxed at the standard rate. The consideration is without VAT (corresponds to 100%). Supplies received after December 31, 2010 must be declared in Ref. 381. Additional information can be found in the VAT Info 14 Acquisition tax.
tax_calculation_section.381_help: Please enter the supplies received for the acquisition tax here. As a rule, the supplies received are taxed at the standard rate. The consideration is without VAT (corresponds to 100%). Supplies received after December 31, 2017 must be declared in Ref. 382. Additional information can be found in the VAT Info 14 Acquisition tax.
tax_calculation_section.381_help_prior2018: Please enter the supplies received for the acquisition tax here. The supplies received are taxed at the standard rate. The consideration is without VAT (corresponds to 100%). Supplies received before 1.1.2011 must be declared in Ref. 380. Additional information can be found in the VAT Info 14 Acquisition tax.
tax_calculation_section.382_help: Please enter the supplies received for the acquisition tax here. As a rule, the supplies received are taxed at the standard rate. The consideration is without VAT (corresponds to 100%). Supplies received before January 1st, 2018 must be declared in Ref. 381. Additional information can be found in the MWST Info 14 Acquisition tax.
tax_calculation_section.400_description: Input tax on cost of materials and supplies of services
tax_calculation_section.405_description: Input tax on investments and other operating costs
tax_calculation_section.410_description: De-taxation (art. 32, please enclose a detailed list)
tax_calculation_section.410_help:
Here, declare the input tax that could not be deducted earlier due to the conditions as detailed in Art. 28 para. 1 MWSTG. A detailed list must be enclosed with the declaration.

The list must be sent to the FTA by mail. The applicale form for the declaration must be enclosed with the list. Further details can be found in the MWST-Info 10 Nutzungsänderung.
tax_calculation_section.415_description: Correction of the input tax deduction: mixed use (art. 30), own use (art. 31)
tax_calculation_section.415_description_final: Corrections for immovable goods (Art. 82 para. 2 and Art. 93 VAT Ordinance)
tax_calculation_section.415_help:
Here, both positive and negative amounts can be entered. Please note that the calculation will automatically deduct the amount. Minus minus therefore becomes plus.

The result can be seen in Ref. 479. Further details can be found in the VAT Info 09 Vorsteuerabzug u. -korrekturen.
tax_calculation_section.420_description: Reduction of the input tax deduction: Flow of funds, which are not deemed to be consideration, such as subsidies, tourist charges (art. 33 para. 2)
tax_calculation_section.420_help:
Here, both positive and negative amounts can be entered. Please note that the calculation will automatically deduct the amount. Minus minus therefore becomes plus.

The result can be seen in Ref. 479. Further details can be found in the VAT Info 09 Vorsteuerabzug u. -korrekturen.
tax_calculation_section.471_description_prior2018: Tax credit according to form no. 1055
tax_calculation_section.510_description: Credit in favour of the taxable person
tax_calculation_section.collapsable_info_1: Do you have turnover to declare at the former tax rate (to 31.12.2017)?
tax_calculation_section.collapsable_info_1_prior2018: Do you have turnover to declare at the former tax rate (before 01.01.2011)?
tax_calculation_section.collapsable_info_2: Do you have to declare acquisition tax at the former tax rate (to 31.12.2017)?
tax_calculation_section.collapsable_info_2_prior2018: Do you have to declare the acquisition tax at the former tax rate (before 01.01.2011)?
tax_calculation_section.title: II. Tax calculation

turnover_section.200_description: Total amount of agreed or collected consideration incl. from supplies opted for taxation, transfer of supplies acc. to the notification procedure and supplies provided abroad (worldwide turnover)
turnover_section.205_description: Consideration reported in box 200 from supplies exempt from the tax without credit (art. 21) where the option for their taxation according to art. 22 has been exercised
turnover_section.220_description: Supplies exempt from the tax (e.g. export, art. 23) and supplies provided to institutional and individual beneficiaries that are exempt from liability for tax (art. 107 para. 1 lit. a)
turnover_section.220_help_pss:
With the flat-rate method, the export sales reported under no. 200 may be deducted under no. 220.

In this case, you waive the right to offset the input tax calculated on form 1050 and you cannot deduct input tax under no. 470 of the statement form.

Please refer to the VAT Info 13 for further information.
turnover_section.220_help_sss:
With the net tax rate method, the export sales reported under no. 200 may be deducted under no. 220.

In this case, you waive the right to offset the input tax calculated on form 1050 and you cannot deduct input tax under no. 470 of the statement form.

Please refer to the VAT Info 13 for further information.
turnover_section.221_description: Supplies provided abroad (place of supply is abroad)
turnover_section.225_description: Transfer according to the notification procedure (art. 38, please submit Form. 764)
turnover_section.225_help:
Article 38 para. 3 of the VAT Act provides that transfer of supplies according to the notification procedure (reorganisations in accordance with Articles 19 or 61 Federal Direct Tax or transfers of all or partial assets) must be declared as part of the regular VAT declaration.

The turnover deducted in this Ref. must also be declared in Ref. 200. Form No. 764 (Notification procedure) must be sent to the FTA by mail. When sending this form, you must enclose the applicavle form from the declaration.

For additional information, see VAT Info 11 Notification procedure.
turnover_section.230_description: Supplies provided on Swiss territory exempt from the tax without credit (art. 21) and where the option for their taxation according to art. 22 has not been exercised
turnover_section.280_description: Miscellaneous (e.g. land value, purchase prices in case of margin taxation)
turnover_section.280_help: If a deduction is made in this Ref., please indicate what this is under 'Miscellaneous' (MWST-Info 15, Kapitel 1.3).
turnover_section.299_help: This Ref. is for a plausibility check only, the calculated total taxable turnover must be identical to the total taxable turnover in Ref. 299.
turnover_section.title: I. Turnover
turnover_section.title_annual: I. Turnover not declared in the regular declaration

error.title: An error has occurred
error.wrongPhoneNumber: It is not possible to submit a VAT declaration with a VAT token using a foreign mobile phone number. Please register with a Swiss mobile phone number.

banner1.title: Web-Publi 2.0
banner1.txt: All VAT information can be found in the practice publications.

banner2.title: Q & A
banner2.txt: Do you have questions about VAT-Declaration easy? Here you will find the answers to the most frequently asked questions.

card1.title: Extend deadlines
card1.txt: The declaration and payment deadline can be extended easily online.

card2.title: Certificates
card2.txt: Do you need a VAT registration certificate or an entrepreneur's certificate?

card3.title: Instalments
card3.txt: To pay VAT in instalments, you can apply for a payment plan online.

card4.title: VAT registration
card4.txt: Is your company liable to VAT and do you have to register?

easy.info: Access is only possible with mobile phone and Swiss number.
easy.mobileWarning: Access is only possible with mobile phone and Swiss number.
easy.title: Enter VAT token
easy.txt: If you have received a VAT token by mail or in the summary of the last submitted declaration, log in as a guest and submit your VAT report quickly and easily.

card1.title: Web-Publi 2.0
card1.txt: All VAT information can be found in the practice publications.

cardMwst.title: VAT registration
cardMwst.txt: Is your company liable to VAT and do you have to register?

cardRegistrationComp.title: Register a company/person
cardRegistrationComp.txt: Have you not yet registered a company for VAT? Register your company, so that we can send you a registration code by mail. You can then fill in and submit your declaration reports quickly and easily.

cardSuissetax.title: Transfer from Suisse Tax
cardSuissetax.txt: Did you previously submit your VAT in "Suisse Tax"? Simply transfer your data and authorizations.

pro.title: Fill in and submit declaration reports quickly and easily
pro.txt: Do you also want to use correction reports, annual rectifications, deadline extensions and other functionalities with VAT? Simply create a user account and use VAT-declaration pro free of charge.
pro.warning: If you have already submitted the VAT in SuisseTax before, you can simply transfer your authorizations after registration.
pro.widgetInfo: In order to use VAT-declaration pro, you must first activate a company.

login.content: You must first log in at least as a guest to use this service. For security reasons, a Swiss mobile phone number is required.
login.title: Login to the Portal

nextVatToken.hintCode_1: Please take a note of the VAT token to use for the next reporting period. The VAT token is also included in the PDF of the summary, which you will receive in the end of the declaration process.
nextVatToken.hintCode_2: You need this code for the next reporting period.
nextVatToken.title: Next VAT token

reminder.noReminder: No reminder can be selected for previous reporting periods.
reminder.title: Automatic reminder
reminder.tooltipAddToCalendar: The reminder for the next declaration report appears directly in your calendar. The VAT token for the next declaration form is included.
reminder.tooltipSendReminder: You will be informed by email and/or SMS when the new declaration form is ready for submission. For security reasons, the VAT token is only included in the SMS option.

dialog.confirmHint: After confirmation, changes can no longer be made.

dialog.confirmHintMwstPro: After confirmation, corrections are only possible with the correction report.

dialog.summaryApprovalPaper:
You have corrected the declaration report for the {{period}} for the company {{company}}. The previously created declaration approval is invalid.

By clicking CONFIRM, the declaration report can be approved only with the newly created declaration approval.
dialog.summaryRectification: Confirm that you want to submit the {{company}} correction statement for the {{period}}.
dialog.summarySchluss: Confirm that you wish to submit the final declaration of the {{company}}.
dialog.title: Is your declaration correct and complete?

submission.previewDescription: Please verify your data in the PDF declaration report..
submission.submitDescription: Submit the declaration after verification. If at least one other person is entitled to submit VAT declarations for this company, you are free to provide the declaration report to be submitted by them. All authorized users will be informed automatically.
submission.tooltipElectronic: Select this variant, if you wish to submit the declaration directly and electronically. There is no need to sign or send the declaration report by mail.
submission.tooltipPaper:
If you want the declaration approved and/or signed by someone else, please send the signed Approval of Declaration which you will receive in the next step, by mail.
Important: The declaration is only considered submitted when the signed Approval of Declaration is received by the FTA.
submission.variantPaper: Submit with Approval of Declaration via mail

dialog.message: By clicking OK, you confirm that the declaration approval has been received by the FTA and is visible in the PDOS.
